meanings.definition: Superlative form of still, meaning the most quiet or calm.
meanings.sent1: The library is the stilliest place in town.
meanings.sent2: The forest was the stilliest I had ever experienced.
meanings.sent3: The stilliest cat in the neighborhood never meows loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was the stilliest lake, reflecting only peace.
meanings.sent5: The stilliest night was filled with the sound of crickets.

meanings.definition: Superlative form of still, meaning the most motionless or stationary.
meanings.sent1: The statue stood stilliest in the park.
meanings.sent2: The pond was the stilliest body of water I had ever seen.
meanings.sent3: The stilliest rock in the garden never moved an inch.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like the stilliest stone, unmoved by emotions.
meanings.sent5: The stilliest car on the road seemed frozen in time.
